definition: see 亭臺樓閣|亭台楼阁[ting2 tai2 lou2 ge2]

sentences.english: The pavilions throw their shadows in the water.
A new wine cup last year old pavilions, weather.
sentences.chinese: 一曲新詞酒一杯，去年天氣舊亭臺。

sentences.english: A new wine cup last year old pavilions, weather. When the sunset?
sentences.chinese: 一曲新詞酒一杯，去年天氣舊亭臺。夕陽西下幾時回？

sentences.english: It covers an area of 290 hectares，and has halls，pavilions，corridors and bridges almost everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 它佔地290公頃，亭臺樓閣和迴廊小橋比比皆是。

sentences.english: Most telling, the purpose of the pavilion in the garden was misunderstood as a place for frivolous pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 在大多數的敘述中，亭臺的作用被曲解爲玩樂的地方。

sentences.english: The Garden, reminiscent of those in Suzhou, features more than 30 halls and pavilions .
sentences.chinese: 豫園有30多個亭臺樓閣，風格似蘇州園林。

sentences.english: Pavilions at the northern end of Pei Hai.
To sit pavilions, enjoy the Rouge color.
sentences.chinese: 待坐亭臺，靜賞胭脂水色。

sentences.english: This is the pavilion in which the host arranges feasts.
sentences.chinese: 這就是庭院主人飲宴的亭臺。

sentences.english: Pavilion stands quietly, like a southern girl up the color of the umbrella canopy .
sentences.chinese: 靜靜佇立亭臺，宛如一位江南的少女撐起的彩篷傘。

definition: to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
to cut off/to interrupt/to prevent access
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
